metadata.title: CDA honors martyrs of Operation Bunyan um Marsoos, vows strong defense against aggression

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, May 15 (APP):Capital Development Authority (CDA) on Thursday paid tribute to the martyrs of Operation Bunyan um Marsoos, with officials reaffirming the nationas unity and resolve against external threats. Chairman CDA and Chief Commissioner Islamabad, Muhammad Ali Randhawa, attended as the chief guest, alongside CDA board members, union representatives, and employees. The event honored those who sacrificed their lives in defense of Pakistan, with Randhawa declaring that the nation stands firmly with its armed forces to thwart any aggression. Randhawa stated that Pakistan had demonstrated unwavering solidarity during challenging times, standing ashoulder-to-shouldera with its military to defeat hostile designs. aThe world witnessed how our nation, united like an iron wall, crushed the enemyas evil ambitions,a he said. He emphasized that Pakistanis would never hesitate to sacrifice for their homeland, crediting the armed forces for their bravery and valor. The chairman announced that Youm-e-Tashakkur (Day of Gratitude) would be observed nationwide on Friday (May 16) to celebrate the armed forcesa victory. aThrough Allahas mercy and the nationas prayers, we defeated a much larger enemy,a he said, acknowledging the role of law enforcement and civil institutions in safeguarding the country. Randhawa issued a stern warning to any hostile forces, vowing that Pakistan would apluck out the evil eyea of those targeting its sovereignty. He called for educating younger generations about the sacrifices made for Pakistanas security and independence. Praising the martyrs as aimmortal heroes,a Randhawa reiterated Pakistanas stance on Kashmir, demanding a resolution in line with Kashmiri aspirations. aThe nation stands united against Indian aggression and is ready to sacrifice for Kashmiras cause,a he said. The ceremony concluded with prayers for the martyrsa elevated status and Pakistanas continued security. Events are planned at F-9 Park and the Pakistan Monument on Youm-e-Tashakkur, where the national flag will be hoisted in honor of the fallen.
